Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, both interior and exterior surfaces show severe signs of attrition, the fabric is black in section, the exterior appears to have been covered with a self-slip and bears traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393302) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393302)
Condition: poor (interior and exterior surfaces are very worn)
